title: USA TODAY Bestsellers
text:
The Canadian Press - ONLINE EDITION USA TODAY Bestsellers 
1. "Killing Reagan" by Bill O'Reilly (Henry Holt and Co.) 
2. "The Martian" by Andy Weir (Crown) 
3. "Make Me" by Lee Child (Delacorte) 
4. "Library of Souls" by Ransom Riggs (Quirk Books) 
5. "Come Rain or Come Shine" by Jan Karon (G.P. Putnam's Sons) 
6. "The Girl in the Spider's Web" by David Lagercrantz (Knopf) 
7. "Big Magic" by Elizabeth Gilbert (Riverhead) 
8. "The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Up" by Marie Kondo (Ten Speed) 
9. "Furiously Happy" by Jenny Lawson (Flatiron Books) 
10. "The Girl on the Train" by Paula Hawkins (Riverhead) 
11. "Why Not Me?" by Mindy Kaling (Crown Archetype) 
12. "Gray Mountain" by John Grisham (Dell) 
13. "All the Light We Cannot See" by Anthony Doerr (Scribner) 
14. "Devoted in Death" by J.D. Robb (G.P. Putnam's Sons) 
15. "The Way to a Man's Heart" by Debbie Macomber (Harlequin MIRA) 
16. "Go Set a Watchman" by Harper Lee (Harper) 
17. "Grey" by E.L. James (Vintage) 
18. "To Kill a Mockingbird" by Harper Lee (Harper) 
19. "Raging Heart" by Richard Castle (Kingswell) 
20. "X'' by Sue Grafton (Marion Wood Books/Putnam) 
21. "The End Game" by Catherine Coulter and J.T. Ellison (G.P. Putnam's Sons) 
22. "The Nightingale" by Kristin Hannah (St. Martin's Press) 
23. "The Scam" by Janet Evanovich and Lee Goldberg (Bantam) 
24. "The Girl Who Chased the Moon" by Sarah Addison Allen (Bantam) 
25. "Eve" by William Paul Young (Howard Books) 
Reporting stores include: Amazon.com, Amazon Kindle, Barnes & Noble.com, Barnes & Noble Inc., Barnes & Noble e-books, BooksAMillion.com, Books-A-Million, Bookland and Books & Co., Costco, Davis-Kidd Booksellers (Nashville, Memphis), Hudson Booksellers, Joseph-Beth Booksellers (Lexington, Ky.; Cincinnati, Charlotte, Cleveland, Pittsburgh), Kobo, Inc., Powell's Books (Portland, Ore.), Powells.com, R.J. Julia Booksellers (Madison, Conn.), Schuler Books & Music (Grand Rapids, Okemos, Eastwood, Alpine, Mich.), Sony Reader Store, Target, Tattered Cover Book Store (Denver).
